website_summaries.verdict: An excellent beginner's kit that provides everything you need other than bottles, caps, large pot, and strainer.
pros: Comes with a mix for one gallon of a delicious IPA, and there are other mixes available
cons: For full instructions, you'll need to visit the manufacturer's website

customer_reviews.title: Super dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: I followed all of the instructions to a tee and ended up with bottle bombs. For those unfamiliar, your bottles can become overly-pressurized and start exploding. This creates a huge safety hazard. Glass shrapnel and beer everywhere. Thank god nobody got hurt. There was no warnings about this possibility of anything like this anywhere in the instructions. We did not deviate from the instructions so I’m not even sure how this happened.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Browner

customer_reviews.title: Not for beginner maybe intermediate or the cusp of medium
customer_reviews.text: I liked the carboy I liked the setup but there are no specific instructions. For example "add equal parts water equal parts sugar" how much? Long story short I added too much sugar and my product exploded. I am stupid but not that stupid. I don't think it is for beginners I think its maybe intermediate. The instructions are pictures showing the process not telling specifically what to do. I think I will come back to it when I get more experience.

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous this exploded

So after a week and a half a have a gallon of murky yellow liquid not fermenting. I noticed that it looks like some of the red alcohol in the thermometer seems like it's trapped in the top. customer_reviews.text: I went through the detailed instructions step-by-step, however the product will not ferment. I'm disappointed that I spent this much money on a product that had not only wasted that money but as well as my time. I would like a refund or a reshipment of new product.

customer_reviews.text: Ok so i put a bad review at first, but becoming a believer in the brooklyn brew co. They alway respond quickly and try their best to resolve any issue you may have. I am finishing up my 1st batch of brooklyn brew beer amd it was fun and easy. Cheers
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Good set to start brewing with.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. You have to go on there web page for instructions but that’s ok. They are clear and easy enough. This IPA is not supper hoppy though and I wish it was. But for a beginner it’s a good set to start on.
customer_reviews.author: marcusrick

customer_reviews.title: which was really fun! Directions are clearer online
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a little stay at home date night activity, which was really fun! Directions are clearer online, so make sure you look up the pdf directions over there. They also show you steps on youtube if you search around. I think this kit is probably the best small/starter kit for the price. Be warned though, you definitely want two big stock pots (5 gallons), a funnel, and a large fine mesh strainer. They don't list them as requirements, but I don't see how you can do this without the right tools. Otherwise, great fun, can't wait to try it out!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Huge pain... Be forewarned
customer_reviews.text: This kit has terrible directions. Does not prepare you for all the gigantic pots you're going to need. This will take 4-6 hours of your time. Huge pain. Don't ever get someone a beer making kit if you're not up for a challenge. I'd recommend a wine or kombucha kit instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent IPA
customer_reviews.text: Great All-Grain starter kit. This kit comes with almost all items necessary to make your first gallon of beer. The beer had an excellent flavor and was the first beer that I ever made. Since then, I've made over 100 gallons of beer (in 10 gallon batches though). This kit got me started and got me hooked on it. I still give 5 stars because you really wouldn't want to pay for a kit that included the extra needed items. * You'll need a couple of 8 quart pots (2 gallon), a funnel, and a double strainer. These items make life much simpler when brewing.
customer_reviews.author: Mattums

customer_reviews.title: It tasted great but for whatever reason once i popped each bottle ...
customer_reviews.text: My beer was so unbelievably foamy. It tasted great but for whatever reason once i popped each bottle foam shot up and if I didn't put it in a bigger glass the entire beer would have foamed up and out of the glass. I am sure it was operators error, maybe too much honey, but whatever. It was still good beer.
customer_reviews.author: Beaker

customer_reviews.title: Great kit. Easy to follow instructions I particularly like ...
customer_reviews.text: Great kit. Easy to follow instructions I particularly like the fact that it is an All Grain Brewing kit so I get a chance to experience the entire process from start to finish. Waiting for my capper and caps to arrive so that I can bottle my first batch!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Get ready to make a mess!
customer_reviews.text: Be forewarned, you need a lot of equipment to properly execute. At least two BIG pots (6 qts), a BIG strainer, a BIG funnel. This was a cute gift idea but it's a big project for a small apartment kitchen. And, ultimately, it's a lot of work for a few bottles of kind-of-ok beer. Personally, I'll stick to buying my beer from the pros.
customer_reviews.author: misternickjones

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband for Christmas and he's had a batch going ever since. This is perfect for someone that likes to do things the 'right' way (no shortcuts like extracts etc.). You actually brew real beers and use the true process, it is just in a small scale. He has since got the materials for 5 gallon batch he's but still prefers the short time this kit takes for heating etc. and likes to try batches on a small scale before deciding if he wants multiple gallons of it.
customer_reviews.author: Flash
